intro: Pouzolzia arachnoidea, commonly known as the spider-tail plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the southern United States, particularly Texas, and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, narrow, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Pouzolzia arachnoidea is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
